Class com.heaton.bot.HTTP 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class com.heaton.bot.HTTP 

Object
   |
   +----com.heaton.bot.HTTP
public abstract class HTTP
extends Object
This class implements an HTTP handler. The low-level details are left to a derived class. Most likely you will be using the HTTPSocket class, which derives from this one. This class handles these specific issues: + Cookies + The referrer tag + HTTP User Authentication + Automatic Redirection + Parsing headers Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jeff Heaton

_agent
The agent(or browser) that the HTTP class is reporting to the server.
_autoRedirect
True if the HTTP class should automatically follow HTTP redirects.
_body
The body data that was downloaded during the last send.
_clientHeaders
The client headers, these are the headers that are sent to the server.
_cookieStore
The cookies that are being tracked by this HTTP session.
_header
The raw header text that was recieved during the last send.
_maxBodySize
The max size that a HTTP body can be.
_password
The password being reported for user authentication.
_referrer
The page previously on.
_response
The HTTP response(i.e.
_serverHeaders
The server headers, these are the the headers that the server sends back.
_timeout
The timeout in milliseconds.
_url
The URL that was ultimately used during the last send.
_useCookies
True if session cookies should be used.
_usePermCookies
True if permanent cookies should be used.
_user
The user being reported for HTTP authentication.

com.heaton.bot.HTTP()

SetAutoRedirect(boolean)
Used to determine if the HTTP class should automatically resolve any HTTP redirects.
addAuthHeader()
This method is called to add the user authorization headers to the HTTP request.
addCookieHeader()
This method is called to add any applicable cookies to the header.
clearCookies()
This method is called to clear any cookies that this HTTP object might be holding.
getAgent()
Returns the user agent being reported by this HTTP class.
getBody()
This method is called to get the body data that was returned by this request.
getClientHeaders()
This method will return an AttributeLIst of client headers.
getCookie(String)
This method is used to access a specific cookie.
getCookies()
This method will return an AttributeList of cookies.
getMaxBody()
This method will return the maximum body size that will be downloaded.
getPassword()
This method is used to get the password that is being used for user authentication.
getPerminantCookies()
This method allows you to determine if permanent cookies are being used.
getReferrer()
This method is used to get the referrer header
getServerHeaders()
This method will return an AttributeList of server headers.
getTimeout()
This method will return the amount of time in milliseconds that the HTTP object will wait for a timeout.
getURL()
Get the URL that was ultimately requested.
getUseCookies()
This method allows you to determine if session cookies are being used.
getUser()
This method is used to return the user id that is being used for HTTP authentification.
lowLevelSend(String, String)
This method actually sends the data.
parseCookies()
This method is called internally to parse any cookies and add them to the cookie store.
parseHeaders()
This method is called internally to process user headers.
processResponse(String)
send(String, String)
Send is the public interface to this class that actually sends an HTTP request.
setAgent(String)
This method is called to set the agent reported to the browser.
setMaxBody(int)
This method will set the maximum body size that will be downloaded.
setPassword(String)
This method is used to set the user's password for HTTP user authentificaiton.
setReferrer(String)
This method is used to set the referrer header
setTimeout(int)
This method is called to set the amount of time that the HTTP class will wait for the requested resource.
setURL(String)
Called to set the internal URL that is kept for the last request.
setUseCookies(boolean, boolean)
This method controls the use of cookies by this HTTP object.
setUser(String)
This method is called to set the user id for HTTP user authentication.

_agent 
protected java.lang.String _agent
The agent(or browser) that the HTTP class is reporting to the server.

_autoRedirect 
protected boolean _autoRedirect
True if the HTTP class should automatically follow HTTP redirects.

_body 
protected java.lang.StringBuffer _body
The body data that was downloaded during the last send.

_clientHeaders 
protected com.heaton.bot.AttributeList _clientHeaders
The client headers, these are the headers that are sent to the server.

_cookieStore 
protected static com.heaton.bot.AttributeList _cookieStore
The cookies that are being tracked by this HTTP session.

_header 
protected java.lang.StringBuffer _header
The raw header text that was recieved during the last send.

_maxBodySize 
protected int _maxBodySize
The max size that a HTTP body can be.

_password 
protected java.lang.String _password
The password being reported for user authentication.

_referrer 
protected java.lang.String _referrer
The page previously on. Used to accurately represent the referrer header.

_response 
protected java.lang.String _response
The HTTP response(i.e. OK). If NOT okay, this response is thrown as an exception.

_serverHeaders 
protected com.heaton.bot.AttributeList _serverHeaders
The server headers, these are the the headers that the server sends back.

_timeout 
protected int _timeout
The timeout in milliseconds.

_url 
protected java.lang.String _url
The URL that was ultimately used during the last send.

_useCookies 
protected boolean _useCookies
True if session cookies should be used.

_usePermCookies 
protected boolean _usePermCookies
True if permanent cookies should be used.

_user 
protected java.lang.String _user
The user being reported for HTTP authentication.

HTTP 
public HTTP()

SetAutoRedirect 
public void SetAutoRedirect(boolean b)
Used to determine if the HTTP class should automatically resolve any HTTP redirects.

Parameters:
b - True to resolve redirects, false otherwise.
addAuthHeader 
protected void addAuthHeader()
This method is called to add the user authorization headers to the HTTP request.

addCookieHeader 
protected void addCookieHeader()
This method is called to add any applicable cookies to the header.

clearCookies 
public void clearCookies()
This method is called to clear any cookies that this HTTP object might be holding.

getAgent 
public java.lang.String getAgent()
Returns the user agent being reported by this HTTP class. The user agent allows the web server to determine what software the web-browser is using.

Returns:
The agent string being presented to web servers.
getBody 
public java.lang.String getBody()
This method is called to get the body data that was returned by this request.

Returns:
The body data for the last request.
getClientHeaders 
public com.heaton.bot.AttributeList getClientHeaders()
This method will return an AttributeLIst of client headers.

Returns:
An AttributeList of client headers.
getCookie 
public com.heaton.bot.CookieParse getCookie(String name)
This method is used to access a specific cookie.

Parameters:
name - The name of the cookie being sought.
Returns:
The cookie being sought, or null.
getCookies 
public com.heaton.bot.AttributeList getCookies()
This method will return an AttributeList of cookies.

Returns:
An AttributeList of server headers.
getMaxBody 
public int getMaxBody()
This method will return the maximum body size that will be downloaded.

Returns:
The maximum body size, or -1 for unlimted.
getPassword 
public java.lang.String getPassword()
This method is used to get the password that is being used for user authentication.

Returns:
The password.
getPerminantCookies 
public boolean getPerminantCookies()
This method allows you to determine if permanent cookies are being used.

Returns:
Returns true if permanent cookies are being used, false otherwise.
getReferrer 
public java.lang.String getReferrer()
This method is used to get the referrer header

Returns:
The referrer header.
getServerHeaders 
public com.heaton.bot.AttributeList getServerHeaders()
This method will return an AttributeList of server headers.

Returns:
An AttributeList of server headers.
getTimeout 
public int getTimeout()
This method will return the amount of time in milliseconds that the HTTP object will wait for a timeout.

getURL 
public java.lang.String getURL()
Get the URL that was ultimately requested. You might get a different URL than was requested if auto redirection is enabled.

getUseCookies 
public boolean getUseCookies()
This method allows you to determine if session cookies are being used.

Returns:
True if session cookies are being used.
getUser 
public java.lang.String getUser()
This method is used to return the user id that is being used for HTTP authentification.

Returns:
The user id.
lowLevelSend 
protected abstract void lowLevelSend(String url,
                                     String post) throws UnknownHostException, IOException
This method actually sends the data. This is where derived classes implement their own low-level send.

Parameters:
url - The URL to send data to.
post - Any data that is to be posted. If no data is posted, this method does an HTTP GET.
Throws: UnknownHostException
Thrown if the host can not be located.
Throws: IOException
Thrown if a network error occurs.
parseCookies 
protected void parseCookies()
This method is called internally to parse any cookies and add them to the cookie store.

parseHeaders 
protected void parseHeaders() throws IOException
This method is called internally to process user headers.

Throws: IOException
Thrown if a network error occurs.
processResponse 
protected void processResponse(String name) throws IOException
send 
public void send(String url,
                 String post) throws UnknownHostException, IOException
Send is the public interface to this class that actually sends an HTTP request.

Parameters:
url - The URL being sent to.
post - Any data to post.
Throws: UnknownHostException
Throws: IOException
setAgent 
public void setAgent(String a)
This method is called to set the agent reported to the browser.

Parameters:
a - The user agent string to be reported to servers.
setMaxBody 
public void setMaxBody(int i)
This method will set the maximum body size that will be downloaded.

Parameters:
i - The maximum body size, or -1 for unlimted.
setPassword 
public void setPassword(String p)
This method is used to set the user's password for HTTP user authentificaiton.

Parameters:
p - The password.
setReferrer 
public void setReferrer(String p)
This method is used to set the referrer header

Parameters:
p - The referrer header.
setTimeout 
public void setTimeout(int i)
This method is called to set the amount of time that the HTTP class will wait for the requested resource.

Parameters:
i - The timeout in milliseconds.
setURL 
public void setURL(String u)
Called to set the internal URL that is kept for the last request.

Parameters:
u - The new URL.
setUseCookies 
public void setUseCookies(boolean session,
                          boolean perm)
This method controls the use of cookies by this HTTP object.

Parameters:
session - True to use session cookies, false not to.
perm - True to use permanent cookies, false not to.
setUser 
public void setUser(String u)
This method is called to set the user id for HTTP user authentication.

Parameters:
u - The user id.
